newsitem.title: USA: Oracle says Oracle8 on track for June.
newsitem.headline: Oracle says Oracle8 on track for June.

text.p: Oracle Corp is on schedule for delivering Oracle8, its biggest new product in several years, on time in June, the software company's finance chief said Tuesday.

"We are on track, on schedule," Jeff Henley, Oracle chief financial officer, told investors at the Hambrecht & Quist Technology Conference in San Francisco. "There is nothing I know of that would slip the June ship date."
Oracle writes computer programs, called databases, that store and retrieve huge amounts of information in corporate computer networks.
Oracle8 is a new version of the company's flagship database product.
Oracle, based in Redwood Shores, Calif., commands about 60 percent of the market for database software, according to recent reports from market researchers.
"We think Oracle8 is going to be a tremendous extension of the position we own with Oracle7," Henley said.
He also told investors he expects the company's fiscal fourth quarter, ending May 31, to be the biggest in revenue for the year.
